frameDefinitions: An Agent or Cause limits a Range_of_options to having a certain Characteristic.
An Item which encompasses characteristics or types whose diversity is indicated by adducing a Limit1 and a Limit2 which differ considerably from each other.
This frame is about the static comparison of an Profiled_item to a Standard_item, often  with respect to some Attribute.
A Group is described as having members which are similar or dissimilar to each other.
A Money_owner exchanges Sum_1 in the  Source_currency for Sum_2 in the Target_currency at some Exchange_service.
The Outcome of a contest is described in terms of the Margin between what would be required for victory and the actual Outcome.
frameExamples: His choices in life have <t>limited</t> his opportunities severely.
The Sun is putting on a show that <t>rivals</t> the most sizzling Hollywood thrillers.
The <t>diversity</t> of students here is to be applauded . INI
After checking into the Intourist-operated $30-a-day Hotel Zerafshon, we each <t>exchanged</t> $50 for Uzbek currency with a shifty loiterer in the lobby at the rate .
The Basque nationalists won a <t>narrow</t> victory in the regional elections on Sunday.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Agent</fen> consciously places limits upon the Range_of_options.
The <fen>Cause</fen> is a natural occurrence or state-of-affairs that limits the Range_of_options.

The <fen>Range_of_options</fen> would normally be expected to have a set of possibilites, but is limited by an <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> to particular subtypes, situations or characteristics.
The <fen>Characteristic</fen> indicates the subtypes or situations to which the <fen>Range_of_options</fen> is limited.
The time at which the limiting takes place.
The location in which the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> limits the <fen>Range_of_options</fen>.
The entity whose scalar property is specified.
The scalar property that the <fen>Item</fen> possesses.
The first-mentioned possibility of the range of variation.
The second item of the range of variation.
The range of positions on the scale that the <fen>Item</fen> occupies.
In active sentences, the <fen>Profiled_item</fen> is the grammatically more prominent one of the items that are compared and realized as  the subject. .
In active setnnces, the <fen>Standard_item</fen> is  the grammatically less prominent element, i.e. the object or an oblique.
This Frame Elements marks constituents that indicate in which respect Item-1 and Item-2 are equal to each other.
The <fen>Standard_attribute</fen> is used when the standard is a specific value on  a scale.
The <fen>Profiled_attribute</fen> is a particular value on a scale which is being compared to a <fen>Standard_item</fen> or <fen>Profiled_attribute</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Profiled_item</fen> rivals the <fen>Standard_item</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Profiled_item</fen> rivals the <fen>Standard_item</fen>.
This role marks constituents that express the set of objects or types whose diversity is at issue.
This role marks constituents which express a property in respect to which the similarity of the <fen>Group</fen> is assessed.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the Group is diverse or homogenous.
The <fen>Place</fen> is the general area in which diversity occurs or exists.
The person who exchanges <fen>Sum_1</fen> for <fen>Sum_2</fen>.
An amount of money in the <fen>Source_currency</fen> that the <fen>Money_owner</fen> exchanges for an amount in the <fen>Target_currency</fen>.
The kind of currency of the <fen>Money_owner</fen> has before the exchange.
The amount of money in the <fen>Target_currency</fen> that the <fen>Money_owner</fen> receives in exchange for <fen>Sum_1</fen>.
The kind of currency that the <fen>Money_owner</fen> receives as part of the exchange.
Currency that is being exchanged by the <fen>Money_owner</fen>.
The time when the currency is exchanged.
The location where the money is exchanged.
The <fen>Outcome</fen> of a contest whose <fen>Margin</fen> is under consideration.
The difference between the minimum required for victory and the actual <fen>Outcome</fen>.
A modifier expressing  the deviation of the <fen>Value</fen> from what is expected given the <fen>Outcome</fen> and the <fen>Value</fen> indicated by the target.
The generally implicit <fen>Value</fen> of the <fen>Margin</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The military</fex> limited building access to key personnel.
<fex>Ongoing rains</fex> have limited drivers to a small number of roads.
The military limited <fex>building access</fex> to key personnel.
The military limited access <fex>to key personnel only</fex>.
Banks are <fex>currently</fex> limiting customers to two cash transactions per day.
Prices range <fex>between 10 and 20 dollars</fex>.
<fex>This PC</fex> stacks up well against its competitors
This PC stacks up well <fex>against its competitors</fex>
The Tri-Cities stack up well against the competition <fex>in the area of innovation</fex>
We equalled <fex>father's skills</fex> .
American caviar <fex>now</fex> rivals Russia's in quality.
<fex>In Africa</fex>, the level of drug resistance rivals even Noatirtin's vaunted efficacy.
<fex>Kornfeldt</fex> hurried through customs, grabbed a city map at a tourist information desk, changed $40 USD into about 300 Hong Kong dollars before leaving the airport
I said forget it and just exchanged <fex>$40 US cash</fex> into $47 and change in Canadian.
We stopped at a bank were we exchanged <fex>Euros</fex> for Danish money.
On the bus we exchanged $50 <fex>for 1410 rubles</fex>.
We had exchanged $100 <fex>into francs</fex> in LAX to be able to pay for the cab ride upon arrival.
I exchanged $1000 <fex>of my money</fex> at the bank.
We walked around Eyre Square and exchanged money <fex>before walking into Taaffes pub and grabbing my first draught pint of Guinness of the trip</fex>.
I exchanged $100 <fex>in Croatia</fex> because i needed a round trip bus ticket to sarajevo.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the Federation of Jewish Communities in Hungary
